comments.text: Stood after the tool boths, got picked up quickly. Right beside me transport inspection was checking lorrys, but they did not care about me
Very good spot to go direction Wroclaw or Germany
Perfect spot, many cars, we (2men) declined offers to katowice and got a lift to Graz in Austria after 30 min.

Used http://krakow.jakdojade.pl/ to find a bus from Kraków city to stop BALICE - INSTYTUT and there is entry to toll gates through gate, guards didn't bother me. Be alert while riding a bus because you need to press a button for bus to stop and in my bus there was no info about the current stop!
I was standing before paytolls, some lorry took me to Katowice after 5 minutes

We waited for a very short time, even thought a lot of cars passed because they vere full of people or stuff (mainly going home from vacation because it was sunday evening). But really nice place to hitchhike especially when someone takes you to this place :). 
First guy who stopped us drove us to Jelenia Góra (we wanted south because we were on our way to Czech Republic).
Very good spot, definitely the best way to get out of Warsaw westward
Great spot, a lot of traffic, got ride to Poznan

Perfect spot for escaping Warsaw. If you go on foot, then there is a 2m fence surrounding it, but a bit to the west there is one gate near a highway emergency exit, which is held only by wire and can be opened
nice place, a lot of cars going through
Good spot, lot's of cars
Many cars stopping there and going to Wroclaw and Germany, found our ride quickly
Stuck my thumb out before the exit and quickly got picked up

Many cars (passengers and trucks) stop here to fill the cars, to rest, eat - lots of choices. I was alone (a girl) and after asking a few drivers (it was at long weekend when most of big trucks can't drive) I found a small truck exactly to dresden when I was going on.
When going to Cracow from Wroclaw it's the last decent place to hitch, because you need to avoid Katowice. Next is tollbooth.
15 minutes with a sign "KRAKÓW"
Many people going to Wroclaw, but also plenty of cars going past Wroclaw. Didn't take us more than about half an hour to get a ride farther west.
Good traffic on sunday. A couple german drivers (berlin). We got a ride after 30 minutes.

With some luck, you can catch a long ride. There were people driving to Ghent (Belgium), but their car was full. Other people where driving to Antwerp (Belgium), but they only wanted to take me to Berlin.
I got here in the evening. There was a guy offering me a ride to Hamburg, another a ride to Berlin, but I had to wait some time (about 1 hour).
Got a ride in couple of minutes towards Krakow. Fence gates were open to access station. 2 M
I believe most traffic is going to the Katowice area, but Krakow is not too hard either. As of august 2025 the hole is still there just before the woods that are close to the exit.

Arguably one of the best spots in Poland. Great to catch a ride towards Wrocław or Katowice. With some luck you can also find a driver going to Kielce, Lublin, Rzeszów or even Ukraine or Czech Republic.

I believe there was a hole in the fence, close to the exit in the bushes. Just go along the fence and you'll find it.

Great spot to go to Wrocław. 

The only thing is, if you want to start from here, and you want to reach the place by bus from Lodz, you have to go through the fence because the gate to the station area is usually closed
Took straight to Czechy, good spot to go to the south
Best place to get out of Warsaw to the West
HONEST spot. Took bus 64 from Brwinów. Walked 15 mins from bus stop and entered through back gate easy. Guy going to NL pulled over within 10 mins.
Very good spot to take ride to Łódź

3 People, 10 minutes until we got our lift to Berlin.
Attention. If you coming by feet there is a 2m fence or a 2m door you have to cross to get to the gas-station.
Two guys. 40min. Really good spot to hitch-hike in the direction of the west. But the only problem is other hitch-hikers haha :) we saw another 3-4 people here.
No much trafic, gave up after an hour
Drivers go slowly, bus stop right after a roundabout with enough space to pull up a car...what else can you want? :)
During rush hours you can often meet a traffic jam here. For hitchhikders it is v. good :)
there is a stopping spot, not too much space, but this is OK, because the cars are coming from a roundabout

It is a lay-by for buses #308 timetable &#809 timetable. It is situated 50 meters right on slip-off from the roundabout.
The bus stop is called "Żmigrodzka (Obwodnica)"
The merged traffic from the city center and the transit one from the A4 motorway is brought here by the newly constructed Wroclaw Ringroad(A8)& passes U by  :-). Cars go slowly while leaving the roundabout so driver can see you easily & has enough time to pull over. It is also a place of a frequent traffic jam occurance
As 1 imag
Good spot. Guaranteed that someone will take you to Rzeszow

We used train to get to Stanislawice from Krakow, normal fare is around 5,5 zl, reduced is about 2,7 zl. It took us about 20 minutes to get to this station from railwail station "Stanislawice". Be aware of fence near this stop, it's everywhere. It took us 30 minutes, but then we found our car to Rzeszow
After two very rainy hours and a good lunch we eventually accepted a ride to Jaroslaw (just east of Rzeszow), while trying to get to Ukraine.
Large gas station with McDonalds. Plenty of traffic towards Tarnow and Rzeszow, but a bit more difficult to catch a ride all the way to Ukraine.
Nice place, I always start my journeys from here. It's usually short rides there, but it always will take you forward outside of Gdańsk to Pruszcz Gdański/Starogard/Tczew
We caught a ride here to Toruń in 5 minutes! Very nice stop, drivers are turning there and going pretty slow + it has a lot of space to stop. Totally recommend :)
Took less thanks 10 minutes to get a ride to the destination we were going. Awsome spot :)
We got a ride in a minute since we got there ;) perfect spot for moving south(direction Łódź).
Busy service station. Was able to find a lift to Suwalki but should be very easy to find one to Lithuania.
Very nice spot if you want get to Suwałki/ Poland Border
Big gas station, lot of trucks. Found a truck to go to Lituania on saturday lunch
I was going to this spot through the bridge and truck driver saw my sign and called me to him. So I get a ride before I reached spot hah
very good, at friday afternoon very hard traffic. no problem to catch a car to Suwalki in 30 minutes

I don't think it's actually legal for the drivers to stop on this lane but either way it's a good place If you are heading North (Mazury lake district) or East (Lithuania). If you are stuck in Lomza and don't want to walk the whole way, take the bus no. 1 and hop off on the bus stop called "Nadnarwianska"
Awsome, lot of cars going. Maybe could have waited for a longer hitch.
Very good spot, a lot of cars & trucks coming through

took us some time to get a ride, but we arrived here at around 2 am. its quite safe in here to hitchhike at night, just sit somewhere inside and ask people coming in. there was a lot of police around because of border nearby
bus stop after roundabout, good spot
Lots of traffic towards Sandomierz, Kielce and Rzeszów. There are bus stops in every direction just after the roundabout.
very good point, there is a roundabout, so cars only accelerate after passing the stop, which helps them notice the sign with our destination city
just after the main crossroads, cars are riding slow and there is a lot of space on a bus stop
Really quick
Good place!
Świetne miejsce!
Very good spot! I highly recommend to hike there to get to Germany! Many cars going there. You don't need anything but a thumb. Mordeczki polecam ten spocik z całego serca!

good place to stop the car to Germany or Koszalin 
bus stop
Kontynuacja opinii, z poniżej

Bezpośrednio z Krakowa do Wrocławia
Złapany koło godziny 12
Lepiej stanąć koło cmentarza przy pasie do skrętu w prawo na stację, wtedy łatwiej kierowc y będą widzieć i będą moi zjechać na symtację

12, o'click direct from Cracow to Wrocław.
Better to stay close to cementary so that drivers will be able to See You and turn right to Pick You up
There is some construction work going on, but that actually slows traffic down, which makes it easier for people to notice you. You can get here by bus from the centre of Kraków in a flash.

After the pandemic the wait time is longer, but this is still a good spot. It's a bus stop, you can get here via city bus or A1 bus that is operated by Koleje Wielkopolskie.Cars go slower here because it's up a slope, if you don't have any luck you can go further down the road via bus, or cross the Street and go back to Kraków.
This is a great spot to get a ride out of Krakow. You can take bus/tram here to this bus stop (Libertów Góra Libertowska).
Good to get to A2

I was left here by driver who took me from Krakow (late Sunday) and just after I left the car and asked the first I noticed there (many stop for gas, to rest etc.) I had a lift to connect A1 (I needed to go the the Czech Republic border).
A good place to find a ride to Ostrava, CZ.

Very good spot to go to Warsaw. It's a bit difficult to get there, but once there, it's an amazing spot. We got there at 22:30 and there was A LOT of traffic. First guy we asked took us to Warsaw. Plus they have free toilets and stuff. If you need long rides towards Łodz or Warsaw or further then this is the spot
If you are going to Warszawa, I would recommend asking just the people with the right license plates and not accepting rides just to Łódź
Very few cars but most are going quite far so it's good to ask every driver that stops here. Direction Warsaw.

Got a direct ride to Gdańsk from here instantly after I stood here.
But I learned out on this spot that I didn't get a job what I wanted :( Sad
Anyways, the spot is really good and people were nice! Spread positivity with others, guys and stay healthy!
to Gdańsk, bus stop (line 415)

Great spot, lots of cars going slowly. Stand at the crosswalk which is at too of “hill” so cars can see you. A few meters further down there is a bus stoo where they can pull over.
Easy to get to by public transportation, we took bus 307 from center.
it's a very good spot to hitch, I never wait too long for someone to pick me up.

it's a very good spot to hitch, I never wait too long for someone to pick me up.
There is a bus stop ("Michałowice Komora" - bus 257, you'll need a ticket for second zone) just after a pedestrian crossing so cars drive slowly and can easly stop to get you.
Group of employees were comming home. near to Gdansk.
Plenty space at the exit from the rest place, but not many cars coming. For a long distance HH still good I think.

Perfect spot to head north towards Warsaw. Use a sign though. There's a bus stop where the cars can pull over and even a pedestrian crossing with traffic lights you could abuse to your advantage if you're evil enough.
I was on the way to the roundebound and a car stopped to pick me up direction warzawa. On sunday morning 10 am. Some traffic and some space and lighttraffic to stop
Easy to Lublin
Szybko złapaliśmy stopa do Lublina
Greaat spot to go to Katowice.
Very fast, there is a bus stop
Perfekt spot to go to Poznan. Many cars. Got a ride in a few minutes.

PERFECT.
If you are trying to get to Poznan, this is the best spot around. Most people stopping there are going towards Poznan anyway. Got a ride in few minutes.

One of the best places to hitchhike near Katowice. We planned to go in the direction of Ostrava in the further Budapest and we managed to catch the driver to Vienna. Overall, a great place to catch a foot in the direction of Wroclaw, Berlin, Vienna. It is worth going to the parking lot and asking people where they are going - a lot of individual drivers and trucks.
Best spot in Katowice Area to get anywhere
There is a exit from gas station with plenty space to hitchhike.

In no time I got ride to medyka border crossing however my driver told me that if I will wait for his wife to cross border I will be able to get to lviv with his wife's friend so I did it. However at the Ukrainian side I found out that she doesn't have a car and we ended up hitchhiking together to lviv itself or more exactly she ask someone near the border and he took us. If I knew that I would probably cross the border just after coming to medyka and then hitchhike to lviv by myself but in the
one of my favourite ways to catch a car — waiting for cars to slowly exiting a patrol station. a lot of cars here are going towards ukraine/lviv/smth else, really nice spot. good in any time of a day

We wanted to try after the pink bridge, but the place has been closed with a barrier so cars cannot stop. We tried just before the bridge, but as nobody was stopping, we moved to the bus stop, and got a ride in 20min.
Got a short ride in no time.
We didnt even put our bags down when a guy heading in Jabłonka direction stopped and took us a few kilometers. Good bus stop and most people ride towards South

What was said before is true
But if you wait at the exit of the station/McDo, there is no place to stop and it's in a turn, or there is but the wrong side of the road. Actually it's no big deal, the spot is good

Amazing MOP for north direction, used a lot and most traffic goes serious long distance, a ride to Warszawa the least, you can ask around or thumb or use sign, I imagine everything would work here, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
Tutaj jest dobry spot na łapanie w kierunku Bełchatowa i A1
Good visibility, much place to stop, people willing to take - two cars took group of 5 within 5 minutes
Good visibility, much place to stop, people willing to take - two cars took group of 5 within 5 minutes
It was late, we've already lost hope, but than...he arrived
Good spot for gdansk. We got nice ride almost to gdansk. It leads to atostrade.
Got a ride in a 5 minutes to Wrocław

Great spot. They can see you from traffic lights right on the opposite, so they can Made up their mind. There is a lot of space for stopping for the vehicle. 
We had a great ride with an amazing woman, she drives to Wroclaw frequently, so if you meet her, say her hello from Czech couple😊. We were talking all the time untill we were Wroclaw.
very good spot on a gas station
You would find a way to get there.
Great place to get a lift towards Lublin. Usually takes not longer than 10 minutes.
5,15 and 20 minutes waiting time

Not a bad spot. A truck leaving the parking lot across the road from Lidl waved at me and got me to a gas station, where I switched cars with one of his friends. I think you might be able to get a ride to Augustów from here relatively quickly.

This is a good spot, but you have a dilemma here when going north. You can take either the highway exit or the local one; they are right next to each other. I chose the local route, and it might have been a mistake. Both of them have plenty of space to stop.
Not a bad spot, if you are going north, just take a short hitch to Stawiski and continue from there.

Ok, I might be a little bit biased, but this is one of those spots in my heart. The whole Wojska Polskiego Road is nice; there are places to stop every couple of meters, and I think there is a bus stop as well. I got lucky here and got a ride all the way to Kołno, even though I thought this would just be a short last ride of the day. They took me 100 km north, and it was a great ride.
Perfect spot towards Ciechanów, there is a bus stop just after the roundabout, good visibility, and slow traffic.
Good spot, somewhere around here is a bus station. I would advise you to stay on that. Many cars go to Sochocin and Ciechanów.
Not a bad place towards Płońsk, cars go slowly and stop even though there isn't a great place to stop.
If you want to Jelenia Gora, than this is a nice spot.
Best spot if you want to go to bigger city (Rzeszów, Lublin) or just want to ride to the nearest expressway (S19)
you are visible here, nothing special
We wanted to go northbut we were unlucky on the north direction of highway. So we decided to go like under Poznan. It was right decision.
It's better to hitchhike here than on border. People don't want to stop on border I guess. Couple of pensioners took as between Wroclaw and Leszno.
go long distances
Not to much traffic but spot in general is good
perfect spot to take a ride to east Poland, good place to stop for drivers
First car took me to Brno

It rained quite heavily, so I found shelter nearby Vynoteka. A lot of people going to Lithuania buy cheap alcohol in Poland's border, and I believe this is one of the last alcohol stores in the north.

Nia unua veturo post longa piediro el Zittau, ĉar multaj teamoj provis el la urbo, ni decidis iri al pli strategia loko. Sed ni strategiis malĝuste, ĉar mi ne sciis, ke ni finfine transirus la polan limon piede, kaj mi havas brazilan pasporton, do ili kondukis nin tien dum 30 minutoj por esplori Dion kaj la mondon.
With a sign saying Piwniczna, got a ride directly to the border
With sign to Piwniczna
Sign saying Piwniczna, got a ride to a better spot
Space for cars to pull over, not hard to find a car to Lublin
Quickly got a ride to close to Zamość, lots of space for cars to pull over and they’re not going that fast
Super easy to Białystok
Better not to have a sign, it’s very likely the first car will take you to Trześcianka and you can go further from there. Started with a sign but people don’t wanna take you if you’re going too far
I was walking, first car I thumbed stopped and took me to the next village
Cars are fast but they can easily pull over, wasn’t too long to get a ride to Białystok even though it was a bit late
Good to Augustów, space for cats to pull over on the bridge
Nice spot to Jelenia Gora.
excellent spot for going south, a lot of traffic and they are going slowly. there is a good spot to stand behind the roundabout
I had a sign saying “Pavlowice”. First car stopped and gave me a ride to Żory.
Lot of cars passing slow, someone will definitely take you. And there is even a busstop. So ideal place to park.
Great spot to go to Gdansk even at night.
Great place to go towards Krakow. gas station + McDonald's -> a lot of potential drivers and easy to catch them for a talk.
Bus stop behind roundabout. Slow traffic. Perfect spot.
Good spot towards Augustow/Suwalki, cars are going slowly cause of speed cameras, there's a big exit/parking right next to it
a nice MOP accessible from the old road (333), the gate was open, a guy took us right away when we arrived
Na Wrocław bardzo szybko idzie złapać, czasem bezpośrednio a czasem na 2-3 razy
Very good spot if you are going direction to Czech or Austria. Just showed my sign and the first truck took me to Brno
30 min of asking people to take us

Perfect spot, every car from Hel and nearby have to go through this round. After few minutes I got a catch exactly where I wanted, straight to Wrocław, but there was a lot of cars from all over poland, specially in the summer season.
We got a car to Politechnika really fast. You can both ask at the gas station or on the minor road
We got extremely lucky and found a car to Warsaw. It helped probably that it was the last day of the Easter holidays
Very good traffic and place to pull over.
Great spot. Cars are going slow from the roundabout and there is a space at the bus station.
There is a space for a car to stop on a bus station.
We waited at the exit from the rest place. There was a good visibility and space.
A lot of cars and easy ride to Sulechów
Good spot to hitchhike to Krosno. Easy ride.
Great spot to hitchhike trough villaged and counties to Krosno Odrzanskie. Recommend to stop in the Gryżyny or Niedźwiedź village
Gas station, McDonald's, quite a lot of foreign cars and trucks drivers. Just stood at the exit with sign Wrocław, and got a truck all the way.
First service station after Warsaw on route to Lublin. Probably only reasonable way to get here is to be driven here by a driver
Busstop on a highway ramp with shade. Local traffic but also cars going to the highway. Got a ride to gas station on the highway
Bus stop on the road going to Marki, close to S8 road going north from Warsaw. Couple, ~25yo, summer sunny morning. Hitchhiked with "S8" sign. Recommend it. Catched a lady going north, to Wyszków.
Many spice for car
Great spot to Poznań
We were 3 people but still got a ride quite fast to Szczecin!

A huge fan of polish history took us and told us all the history of Poland in 1H =)
Apart from that, the spot is nice, with a high visibility, and you don't have to walk a lot from the center.

It was the time of Poland'Rock festival, so a lot of cars were going to Czaplinek, as our drivers. We decided to stop to Pila, but could have reach the festival straight. Maybe on a standard day, it wouldn't work so easily...

Huge place to stop, with a high visibility. Cannot be better =) 
And our crazy driver invited us to his place to have a coffee and eat some polish dishes, big love on him!

We tried at the petrol station, but nobody was stopping, so we went a bit further in the village, and got a ride in 5min. We were going to the north, and our driver nicely agreed to let us after the city, on the way to Lubin.
We got a ride thanks to a guy that took us and asked some other Poles :)
The driver was very nice, even took us further than was his destination and at MOP he talked to strangers and got us a ride to Katowice
very good spot for going towards Görlitz if you're on this road.
a pretty okay spot if you're going towards Görlitz
Good place to HH in all directions (Krakow, Wrocław, Gdańsk or Warsaw). There is a petrol station and McD.
Good spot if u go to Slovakia. A lot of space for cars or trucks to stop.

MOP Service station exit to the motorway, I waited near the exit, there is really good visibility, even at night there are 2 lampposts nearby to stand under. Had a sign for WAWA, but I'm sure just your thumb should do the trick as well if you're trying to get anywhere along the motorway 👍

Very good spot at a bus stop going in the direction to Kłodzko if you can't get a ride out of the village, walk here and wait at the opening of the bus stop. I had a sign saying Kłodzko and got picked up in 20 minutes of waiting
Lot's of cars, some trucks. Got a ride to Warsaw by asking around
Towards Bogatynia or Zawidow, use the speeding lane here rather than the bus stop, good amount of traffic, good visibility
Really nice spot if you want to go outside of the peninsula, we were lucky because we stopped a woman who went our direction. It is nice wide spot, and when the train passen it stops a lot of cars.
It was really nice place, bus stop, we waited very short time. Many people are going to Lebork from there.
Very good spot for going towards eastern poland, we are 2 guys and we had a stettin sign but we stil got picked up after only 20 minutes but we only got driven to slubsk
good spot to get to E8 road from skierniewice. usually takes around 15 minutes to get a ride
you can get to katowice or even kraków from here

i hitchhiked here several times, usually it takes between 1-20 minutes to get a car going far south. a lot of people going south to częstochowa and katowice stop here. if you want to go to south of poland be patient and dont go to rawa mazowiecka (theres a lot of cars going there but getting out of rawa is difficult)
cars go slowly here because of the queue for a troll station, the best place to hitchhike in this area towards east poland like rzeszow or ukraine
there is a bus stop, we met a nice guy who let us smoke weed inside
Great place, cars have an option to park safely on BP station. We cought a ride after 9 mins to Warsaw.

Very good spot now due to the increased controls on Polish side, so the cars are slow or even stay in line, so you can really make an impression on the drivers. Got taken by two Ukranianians going to Wroclaw. 

Extra note: The police asked us for passports too, IDs were not enough even though we are EU citizens.
Basic and good spot at petrol station, good way to stay on the main road to Warsow

Poland is so easy to hitchike broo random bus stops I didn't even have a sign and a guy in a TRUCK stopped on the bus stop and took me to tarnow. Poland is the easiest country to autostop in my opinion (I've hitchhiked in Germany, Belgium, france, Italy, Austria, Hungary, Slovakia, Croatia, bosnia so I guess I know what I'm saying)

Not much traffic, but it's steady. Plenty of space to pull over. Cars are going slow and have lots of time to see you. 
A guy stopped after 5 min, but was going a different way. 5 min later another guy stopped and gave me a ride to a reststop 40km from Warsaw.
Low-medium traffic. Cars go slow, lots of time to see you and lots of space to stop. Got a ride by a Ukranian family all the way to Lodz.
There is a bus stop and this place is definitely the best for riding to slovakia
good spot in directon to a1 and kamiensk
great spot for catch cars in direction to Czestochowa by old road nr 91
Świetne miejsce
Many trucks want to transport us, but I traveled with my friend so we waited for cars. After 60 minutes at 8 AM we founded transport to Kaunas
Towards Sokolow Podlaski, great bus stop, good visibility and the speeds are not that high yet, wait time of 5-15 minutes expected
Wide roadside shoulder towards S8 or Lochow, okay amount of traffic, low speeds, wait time of 5-10 minutes expected
Just after a roundabout decent width road for stopping a car going towards Wyszkow, okay amount of traffic, wait time of 5-15 minutes expected

The bus L-9 takes you here, as of now (June 2025) the road is under construction and this bus stop is ideal since the construction starts around here, the cars slow down and it's a nice bus stop to stop to go towards Serock, a lot of local traffic tho, expected wait time of 5-10 minutes if you are not picky with rides

Towards Kielce, there's actually busses here that you can just walk in and get free to Kielce but if you want to go further you can stand here, the bus stops were full of people but cars turning from Brzeziny will most likely stop with 5-10 minutes of waiting, where you can control more where you wanna go than with the bus
Towards Morawica/Kielce, there's a small side on the road where cars can stop, not the comfiest but speeds are slow so you will probably get a car within 10-15 minutes
Good bus stop towards Staszow, decent amount of traffic, might get a ride to Kielce, speeds are slow due to roundabout earlier, wait time of 5-20 minutes expected
Good bus stop towards Polaniec, very good visiblity for cars, pretty wide for stopping also, wait time of 5 minutes
Same story, wide entrances for houses, good traffic with speeds not that high, for short rides to get out of Mielec this is a very good road, direction Gawluszowice, wait time of 5 minutes

Wide entrances to the houses, since there is traffic light before the speeds are low, quite some cars, good for going northbound and getting out of Mielec, ask for Gawluszowice, don't expect a long distance ride here tho, wait times of 5-10 minutes expected

Not much of a shoulder after the roundabout but the speeds are slow and you can catch a car going towards Tarnobrzeg within 10 minutes, just don't go too far away from the roundabout since they tend to speed up there quite fast

Towards Stalowa Wola, great spot, you can just hitchhike in Zaklikow, wide sidewalks and speeds are slow, long straight part with good visibility, nice amount of traffic and locals are friendly, wait time of 5 minutes to be expected

Excellent bus stop for going towards Lublin, nice big building where u can hitch in rain as the roof covers you pretty well, speeds are very low, a lot of traffic and most cars go to Lublin the least, expected wait time of 5 minutes here (side note: probably will be outdated once the new road S19 has been built but for now this is amazing spot)
Wide entrance to those buildings, direction Siemiatycze, decent traffic, after this the speeds go up and I wouldnt recommend walking any further, expected wait time of 5-20 minutes
Towards Siemiatycze, the houses here have wide entranceways, as well as the speeds are slow, expected wait time of 5-15 minutes

Towards Augustow, low traffic, but literally first cars pick you up around here, expected wait time of 5-15 minutes, barely any villages on the road so most likely you will get a direct ride to Augustow, if you go to LT direction avoid Gruszki road and still use this and hitch further from Augustow
To Lipsk, just after roundabout, low traffic but first car usually stops since basically everyone here goes to Lipsk, expected wait time of 5-15 minutes
Dirction Dabrowa Bialostocka, just after guardrails it is very good road for hitching, first or second car will stop, low traffic, but friendly people. Wait time of 5-15 minutes

Instead of going as far as other reviewers suggest you can just come by here, it has some entryroad on right to some parking that nobody uses and you can just stand before that to signal cars to turn over there, it's wide enough for them to stop, wait time of 5-15 minutes expected for the least Zabludow, but quite some cars go to Bielsk Podlaski all the way also

Towards Sejny/LT, good visibility, decent traffic, be aware that some cars use the road to go Lipsk road so stay a bit further towards Augustow on the side of the road, don't block anyone, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Good visibility if going south, nice walk from the lakes to here, wait time of 5-15 minutes
At first I was holding a sign for Kaunas, but then I decided to use my thumb. The first car that stopped was a Lithuanian who was going to Vilnius
Waited on the other side of town for about 2.5 hours. Went here and got picked up pretty much immediately

Nice spot for going out of Swinoujscie, got 3 offers within 15 minutes, a lot of locals, you could try to get with them past the newbuilt tunnel to the port roundabout, seemed like a very good spot also, but I just waited here for a longer ride, ( you could get a car to all the way to Gdansk and surely to Szczecin)

Dont know the exact spot on the road, we just walked down with a sign after getting out of our sleeping spot(I recommend ear plugs here you’ll find out why). Got a ride almost immediatelly to Zgorzelec. 

If you come here take a look around the town, everything revolves around the huge power plant. Try to look local though, got kicked out by security when looking aroud. They thought we are green peace. They also made us delete our photos lol.

also quick

Great spot for Warsaw. Got picked up super quick. Previous driver lived in Wrocław but was so kind and dropped me at this station.
A bus stop is there, quite a lot of cars turn from the town to the E67 and E30 highway in direction of Lodz. Drivers are friendly.
traffic jam towards gdansk in the late afternoon on a sunday, immediately got a ride. cars can see you quite well and bus stop makes it easy to stop

Very good spot

you dont even need to go all the way, this spot is completely sufficent

suprisingly long wait, but some days are just like that. good spot

Trafic lights and bus stop , ideal spot to catch a ride to krakow

Ride to Olesnica, I would say it is a better place than the one on the other side of the highway…

Pretty nice spot, first car picked up yet again towards Elk, local traffic mostly during winter, wait time of 2 minutes
Smaller gas station with middle traffic. Lot of locals. There were some Czech cars on the parking lots of Lidl and Biedronka. One of them took me to Náchod.
Great spot for baltic countries. Many lithuanian trucks drive by. After hour we stopped a car to Vilnius
There's parking for trucks and small restaurant, good place to stop, but unfortunately cars are going pretty fast. Many Lithuanian cars drive by
Good spot, with space for them to stop.
Za wyjazdem z mcdonalda jest barierka przy drodze i za tą barierką jest małe pobocze z kamyczków

Even though this was a quick ride for me, you can likely find a better spot. There is a large truck parking lot and a McDonald's drive-through; many people use it, so that might be a good opportunity. Also, there is free Wi-Fi at the nearby McDonald's.
ok spot to hitchhike towards Slovakia
To Nowy Sącz
For some reason no one wanted to pick me up in the evening so I gave up and got a ride within 5 minutes the next morning
Not really a great spot, but I believe it is the best in the Wroclaw direction. Hiched from here early summer morning, got a  ride all the way to Wroclaw.
some traffic both ways. cars are going slowly, you dont have a side walk though.
Pretty good spot, a lot of people going south. not much traffic into chechia itself, but you can get closer to the border.
Not a lot of cars, but opened 24/7. Take any ride that takes you closer to Katowice.

A bus stop with enough space for cars to stop. Good spot if you want to get out of Augustów and go to Suwałki (which is eventually much better city to get a ride to Lithuania). Waited 25 minutes with sign Suwałki/Kaunas.
Had luck, but if you are in a direction of Warsaw and you ask around, people will take you at least to the first gas station on the highway (10 km). Which is a good one with McDonald's.
Quite a good place to continue on the road outside Krakow - in the direction of Czech Republic/Slovakia
Years ago on my first trip i got a trucker stop here in the middle of the night and took me to Warsaw. No shade, no facilities, just visability and plenty o’room to stop for even the bigest trucks

there's a wide side next to the road, cars go fast but have plenty of space to stop. a local guy told us that this is where people go to smoke weed and that prostitutes wait there in the summer, so it's probably a good spot for stopping cars:)

a bus stop next to a tank station, where we refilled our water. a nice guy on his way to work drove us to legnica and gave us tips where to hitch next. there's a bush on the corner covering the view a bit, though.
If you want to go out of Gliwice you can try to get here lift to kozłów McDonald's (then we go on the West - Wrocław)
A good spot with a beautiful view. Mostly locals, but we quickly got a ride right up to the Slovak border.
Mostly locals, we quickly caught a short ride towards the Slovak border.
We were looking for tourists but eventually found a local going to Ustron. Should have probably waited more for longer distance
Many locals use to go over there
The spot was not ideal as there was little space for a car to stop, but the cars drove slowly as there is roundabout. We got lucky that one nice guy stopped at the parking lot and took us.
Cars are going fast, but there is a bus stop with a space to stop. We stood at the light to be visible.
The cars are going fast, but there is a space at bus stop.
Just a few cars but good spot to get out from Łagów
Truck stop, no gas station just bathrooms. Not that many cars or trucks, but still a decent steady drop. Asked around and got a car quite soon.
Quite a lot of traffic and space to pull over, however you’re a bit to the right from the road so it might be a bit hard for drivers to see you.
bus stop, people drive slowly. there is tariff patrol stationed on the opposite side but they don't care you're here. 90% german cars not going very far

surprisingly good spot for getting out of the city, you only need to ride a tram and walk a bit to get there. a big parking lot for cars to stop comfortably, people driving very slowly. mostly locals but they'll take you to the border crossing
Cars are going fast, but there is space for them to stop and most are going in the direction of wroclaw, krakow etc
Quite a nice spot. We waited here around one hour and some kind, old hitchhiker in camper van took us to Zlote Hory.
Nice spot at bus stop, also a petrol and McD nearby.
Probably just bad luck, many cars passing by, mostly families with full car
There is a light close to the traffic light. Cars go fast in a lot of lines. We get a direct ride to check cziesin
With sign a direct stop. Fast going cars
Not that many cars but got a lift pretty quickly.
Okey spot to go in direction to Tychy. We had a sign "Warszawa".
I got picked up by a truck driver who was going straight to Vienna. Although he said that it's not a good spot for that far as many ppl head there towards Rybnik.
We waited with the sign, many people went to the gas station, but after like 25 minutes a guy stopped and brought us to Gdańsk.
Very good to hike west-north towards katowice
Relatively long wait but we got a very good ride to Panevezys. Slow traffic, but most cars are local
We've asked a few people on the gas station and one agreed to pick us up, drove straight toWarsaw.
Goodd spot for find a cars in direction to Piotrkow
Good place to catch a car to Kamiensk
Not so good, but the people who exchange some Money can take you for a small road ! 🌸
Ok spot, cars can easily stop and are moving slow. I got lucky the guy was going to a town nearby but decided to go on a detour and drop me at the MOP on the E77
Towards Czyzew, a bit more traffic here but still lots of locals, no shoulders or anything but cars can stop on the road due to low traffic, wait time of 10-20 minutes expected

Towards Ceranow, very low traffic, mostly locals, one of these Polish smaller towns and villages where u can just walk next to the road on sidewalk and stop the cars coming, wide road, wait time expected to be 5-20 minutes

Towards Serock, as of June 2025 there are construction works going on so the speeds are slow, the workers advised me to stay on this side focusing on cars coming from Nieporet as it would be hard to stop cars already on the road due to the nature of the road works, and it did work, a ride within 5-10 minutes, but no real shoulder for them to stop so just be fast to jump into the car

Barely any traffic, but locals are very friendly, most likely first car will pick you up and get you closer to Chmielnik, the question only would be when is the first car gonna come, you can hitch anywhere on this road, wait time of 5-30 minutes expected
Pretty decent MOP, good for southbound traffic, doesn't get most amount of traffic but you'll find a ride south within a hour
Not on this map, but actually there's a bus stop towards Bocki, decent traffic, quite high speeds but literally the only hitchable location around here, wait time around 20 minutes
Towards south, decent village to hitchhike from, but this is about the last good spot around here, so try to accept only rides that go at least to Bocki, wait time of 5-15 minutes
Wide shoulder before roundabout, since everybody goes south anyways might just hitchhike here, wait time of 5-20 minutes, but a lot of locals
Towards Augustow, you'll get a car there pretty fast, but not further, locals turning usually just go to there, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Good spot to escape Radzymin if you want go to Łomża/Białystok/Suwałki
There aren't many good places around, so I recommend asking drivers using gas station. We were lucky and left with the first one asked :-)
Just asked everybody to get a lift to Warsaw. After 20 mins found a guy next to toilet area going to Warsaw. Probably the best place to hitch north because some people were going to Gdansk and Lodz.
Spot to move from Ryn to Giżycko
Around bus station towards Elk, there's also streetlights (not the best) very little traffic around 8-9pm but got a ride with 35 minutes, speeds are low
Decent bus stop but still in the city, hard to get out, direction towards Ostroda, got a ride within 15 minutes
Would put 5, but not sure how legal it would be, got a car towards west within couple minutes
Towards Dabie, good straight road, but little traffic, mainly local, wait time of 20 minutes
Towards Dabie, good location, especially when trains stop the traffic, waited here, there was sort of a shoulder, took me 30 minutes but it was early in the morning, not too many cars

Decent spot to get towards Lodz, I was there late in the evening so not a lot of traffic, speeds are down but be sure to walk down here as up cars cant tell which direction you want to go to, also got recommended parking lot at the other side of the road, but at that time there was only 1 car there, waiting time of 30-35 minutes
Long straight part with speeds down, no shoulder but also not much traffic, towards the direction of Tluste, waited 10 minutes
Nice straight part, last place to get a ride before Blonie if headed to west, also traffic light does slow cars down, got a car here immediately but lots of local traffic
Not the best but decent spot towards south, note that most cars here are local, bust stop with decent width, speeds arent that bad, wait time of 10 minutes
Decent bus stop towards the direction of Szepietowo, not the best but will do the job, little traffic with mostly locals, but got a ride within 20 minutes
Decent spot towards Lapy or Sokoly, not too much space but speeds are low, wait time of 20 minutes or so
I got a ride towards Warsaw in 20min. TBH we were lucky with that, but okay.
Bus stop. Good spot to catch a ride towards Łódź.
Really good spot on the bus stop. Easy to get a ride to Nowy Targ or Kraków even.

It's quite a busy gas station, so I got a ride pretty quickly (without asking, just hitching at the exit). A truck driver passing Kraków took me to the Kraków ring road and dropped me off on the highway. I took a short walk to the nearby Lidl for a bus.
I was going next to the road with my sign on my backpack and some driver pull over to pick me. I was going to the gas station.
Not that much space for drivers to pull over but a steady flow of cars. Very clear at least where you are wanting to get to.
Trying for ride to Warsaw. Driver was not going far so they dropped me further down road at on ramp to S12.
I guess it's ok. Some waiting, but mostly local traffic, although I think it's possible to get long ride here. A lot of traffic and place to stop. Cars are going pretty slow
There's not much space to stop there. Some local traffic, which means only short rides, but still a good place to go somewhere from Pruszcz Gdański
road with almost no place to stop except pathwalk, but its a main road to slovakia, hungary and romania. Romanian truck stopped and took me straight to Oradea.
there is bus stop so cars can stop easily
Nice place to hitch to Siedlce or Lublin, with sign and thumb it was 20 minutes for a ride
Been thumbing at the exit, not a lot of cars stop. Not the best spot, but could work for Poznan/Warsaw direction. Also a bonus point for having a Zabka shop
In my opnion good spot.. a loooot of cars going around! I recommend a big sign and someone will pick you up!
Lot of traffic coming through, worth trying if you are nearby.
Great spot to catch something to Bielsko-Biała
People took us to go to szczecin ! Really nice, not the best spot, but car can stop on the band for the petrolstation.
It's a good spot, however cars drive a bit too fast (it may lower the catch rate).
Smaller gas station (most people go to Wroclaw). Possible to Hitchhick by the road next to it. Got a ride to Swidnica in 15-20 min.
I waited 1 minute but maybe I just got lucky because it was a blizzard and the guy took pity on me. I was going towards Warsaw. Took me more than halfway there.

Not a lot of place to stop a car but anyway...
Last driver left us here. We(boy&girl) caught a car in 15 minutes to the next gas station (2 km)
Pretty fine spot for going to Krakow
Not too many cars but the best spot in town do get out of the Warsaw suburbs
Long waiting but good spot in the middle of a village - bus stop.
a long shoulder, wait just before it
the road was not crowded at 11 am, but got a ride to Olsztyn pretty easily, quite a few cars with the Gdansk licence plates, so there is a possibility to get a ride to Gdansk directly
when I was there, there was a big queue of trucks waiting to fuel up. the fourth guy I spoke to was the first that was driving to Lithuania and agreed to take me as well. not terrible spot, I guess

Great spot to hitchhike to Katowice, I waited 10 mins and got a ride to a town 5-10km away from the City, also got a ride from that town (10.min wait) to the train station in katowice 
(Maybe I was just lucky
Average amount of cars, but ok to get a ride to Katowice.
Fajne miejsce za rondem.
Ride to Swidnica
At the bus stop
There were two more pairs of hitchhikers and all of the groups had a lift. 30 minutes by bus from the city center.

Prostki - Grajewo
People drive here very slowly
Łomża - Warsaw

Grajewo - Łomża
Great place if u wanna go to Łomża, from where its easier to get to Warsaw
Got there at about 9am, waited for about 2hours and got a ride to Wroclaw.

Raz jechałem w kierunku warszawy z tego miejsca, od razu za rondem w kierunku drogi ekspresowej jest ułożona szeroka kostka, gdzie bez problemu może się samochód zatrzymać jadący w kierunku warszawy. Jak tam stałem to był piątek po godzinie 18 gdzie wszyscy wracali z warszawy, a nie jechali do niej.

Hitchhiked by night in winter time. Good street lights, few cars but slow driving a space to pull over on the exit ramp. Truck took me in 5 minutes. Might be worth walking to the next traffic light 3km further at the exit of zamosc.
to Poznań

Probably possible to get further but since there is so little traffic and cars go all the different directions after Warsaw, then when a fifth car stopped and offered a ride to Warsaw centre, we took it. From there we took a hour on the bus to the popular place in Warsaw to go to west and got onto the second car easily. Definitely better to go to Warsaw centre with a ride rather than stop here.
Good spot to get to Warsaw and probably behind it but the traffic isn't too intense soo you might have to wait a little bit longer if you are not lucky
Not much traffic. Was going to Riga,got a direct ride to Vilnius (didnt finish the beer until the ride)

I just had to ask few truck drivers with the right license plates and in less than five minutes I found one going to Białystok. (He told me that in peak hours the trucks can't use the S8, not sure about exact times, but can be found on the internet for sure, so be aware of that), no cars stopping at the servo when I was there (around noon)
Of course it is possible. Be patient and wait for the right license plate (Polish region or next country).

I waited 30min with a SK sign then a Nowy Targ sign. I had no luck and moved towards the highway intersection south of this place and got picked up in 15min towards Myslenice which unfortunately didn't help me a lot.
Got a ride to Rabka after 15 minutes on a Sunday morning with low traffic
I got a lift to Slovakia in 5mins on the national holiday lots of traffic just ask 3 drivers and i had a lift.
IF you are going to direction of Slovakia or Novy targ. Go at least to crossroads near Rabka zdroj because there are not many good places between.
Gas station. in direction of Slovakia.
the first driver I asked took my friend to Łódź
Hi, I traveled from Gdańsk to Katowice in 8 hours
Can't stop traffic on the road, as it is too fast, had a very hard time finding a ride on the bus station
We waited (boy & girl) 1 hour and 10 minutes, after that we go through  after crossroad. and after 15min car pick up us
Petrol station on the bypass, direction Torun, Lodz, Poznan. You can get close to this spot by free bus 807 from Gdansk Zabianka, or bus 7 from Gdynia Karwiny going to Osowa Shopping Centre.
I first waited about 30 minutes at a nearby bus stop without success, then another 30 minutes at the highway ramp before getting a ride. Works, but not the best place. Solo M

Solo, m
Monday morning
Waited 20 minutes, bit of an awkward spot to stop. 50% of traffic is trucks (and they definitely can't stop).
Fine spot, but not sure if it was worth the 1.5h public transport and 0.5h walk to get there
But still best spot in the area, better than before the bridge. I reccomend sign Lodz. Ppl in capital are just not very nice i think, avoid Warszaw when hitchiking if you can.
Not a great spot since cars don't have room to pull over, but I eventually got a ride close to my destination of Łódź.

Stoplight leading to onramp to highway. No place to pull over, but if you can talk to cars stopped at stoplight you can jump in quickly  before light turns green. 
We convinced a car quickly. At first they said no, but since they had to stop at the light, we talked with them through the window and asked to get a ride at least to a gas station, and got a 40km ride towards west

We were two people (male and felmale). Standing there for quite a long time. It is a road from a town so many people yust go from town to different parts of town. We had a sign Litwa. We’ve got a ride to Suwałki.
In the evening (9 pm), no bueno. waited over 40 minutes then gave up due to all local traffic. During the day, a great spot! 10 minutes and we were headed to Augstow :)

Bus stop
Direction: Augustów
Lots of cars, but they don't always have where to stop.
Not a lot of space, but most of the cars go in your direction. Got a ride to Białystok in 10 minutes.
To Bialystok, no place to stop without bothering others, but the traffic is very quiet in the morning.

We had a good time there. It was not a dangerous place. We stood in the end of bus station. We had a sign Olsztyn and there were two of us (male and female). Buses are not a problem there. We recommend this place even though we spent a lot of time in one place.
Try with the sign warszawa and it didn't work. With the sign Elblag, I had to wait 15 mn. It was on Wednesday afternoon

tried in the evening when it was dark without success and gave up after 1h30 of trying, got a ride into warsaw within 15min of getting there the next morning (weekday at 6am). had a sign for Elbląg and was told by the lorry driver that was very good (extra points for the diacritic on the a)

Had no luck on the shoulder leading up the exit. Came here, absolutely horrendous spot, but Polish people really don't care. Got a ride to Boleslawiec. Was a summer evening so traffic was low, which might have actually helped.

I recommend asking around before coming here though.

Waited on the "island" between the entry and exit lanes with a sign for Wrocław and literally the second car that was passing by stopped and brought me to directly to Aleja Bielany. Definitely recommend although might not be exactly legal.
On-ramp Zgorzelec direction Wrocław on the A4. Not really much place for cars to stop but since it's Poland they do anyway. Any ride is good because there's a petrol station 5km down the road.

A lot of traffic here. 
In my opinion better spot than on the highway ramp. Cars have to stop for the red light. Also the driver can turn into the paraller road next to the stores to safely get on.
Kierowcy zatrzymywali się na światłach, i nke chcieli stąd zabierać. To ostatni punkt przed wjazdem na S5. Poszliśmy za rondo.
In my opinion better than the spot further, because the cars go slower because of the traffic lights.
Not a bad spot to get out of the city. Got a ride to a nearby gas station towards Poznan
A truck driver saved me. Was so hard. They all ignored me
Good spot. Also a lot of long-distance-drivers passing here.
MOP Żarska Wieś, A4 direction Wrocław. A bridge just south of the service station gives you a possibility to change to the other side (direction Germany).

My feelings about this spot are mixed. Once I had to go a bit from here by bus as noone stopped for me for an hour. 
But another time I've got an easy ride to Nowy Targ
We were waiting for the car almost 40 minutes, but then we got the ride almost directly to the Budapest.
its quite difficult to get lift from here, traffic lights are placed at the top of the hill. I was standing there for 1,5h and no one even stoped

There is a bus stop 'Ważewskiego' here, where you have enough of place to try hitchhiking. If without a luck, you can always go to the gas station nearby and ask the drivers. Directions: Chyżne, Banská Bystrica, Budapest.

There is a stop sign and parking is prohibited, although the place is good for hitchhiking. 
2023
Wanted to go on the 580 towards Sochaczew, but first car that stopped for us went to Katowice. Confirmation that it's a good spot :)
There is a safe place to stay on a bus stop. Anyways, most traffic goes to downtown and suburbs of Warsaw, but we were able to catch a good ride towards A2 after 15 minutes.

S8 towards road nr. 2. In the future this will be one of the good places to get a ride, once the A2 is completely finished. Right now the S8 merges with the normal road nr. 2. On-ramp with a bus stop, so more than enough place for cars to stop, and they'll also be going slow just after the traffic lights.
I don't know why, but for a very long time people didn't want to stop - we headed towards Rybnik -> Ostrava
We waited 20 mins, we got a lift to Zory.

JACKPOT! 
The first driver we approached on a Sunday morning (8am) took us to Wroclaw.

I was picked up there on my way from Krakow to Dresden, and even if tehre's a lot of cars (passengers mostly), lots of local traffic (because of McDonalds) I waited for an hour for anybody who could take me to the next, much bigger, gas station along A4. I was alone, at start with a sign with my destination, but quickly i started to ask personally. Probably the problem was that I was there on saturday during one a long weekends (with added national holiday) on Monday, and most cars were totally
Many locals on the way, was really hard to pick a ride towards Wrocław. After an hour a guy took us to MOP Wirek, where you can find drivers heading to west.

mostly local traffic. many lithuania cars but almost none stop. I declined 2 rides to marijampole in the hopes of getting a ride further but it was a mistake and i got stuck for 2 hours. its not a bad spot but i think i was just very unlucky. in the afternoon many lithuanians go back from shopping so in the end i got a ride to Kaunas.

Two guys with backpacks, signaling with a sign LT.
Most of drivers were local, but we got a ride to northern Lithuania in less than hour.
Really nice place in my opinion. Put LT on my sign and two cars stopped within 10 minutes on a friday at 12pm.
Many cars ignore you. After 15 minutes we find transport beside to border

Nice spot to get a ride to LT. A few trucks, but mostly you will see a cars. It's not hard to see a lituanian car plates, but they mostly ignore you. Consider to stand here between 14.00 and 18.00, when people comes back form work or form shopping
I've been standing at the next bus station after this one. I used a sign "WWA" After about 1.5 hour I've got a ride directly to Warsaw with a super nice guy.
With a ''Warsowa'' sign i waited 40mins, as always it's terrible with a sign, so i gave it up and in few minutes i was taken to a rest area on the main road

all these spots along this road are good theoretically so i cannot wrap my head around why it took me more than 4 hours (!) to get someone to stop and take me to warsaw. never had a experience this bad anywhere else in poland
Got a ride directly to Warsaw in a couple boy-girl with a sign WWA. Waited 20 min. Good spot - traffic lights and enough space to stop :)

not WWA! people :P
write like that:
 Warszawa or 
WAWA or
W-WA (better than WWA)
worst spot ever, nobody stopped in 3 hours
Unforgettable
good, car to Lomža after 30minutes, there is not any better space in this direction
At 8 PM I wait for 1 hour for car to Warsaw.
Going to Warsaw got a ride in 10 minutes. Stood right before the bus stop. There are shade and no-shade options :)
I was trying to catch a car at 15:00 and I spent 5 hours trying to get a ride towards Warsaw. Drivers generally ignore you and are not willing to stop.

Perfect spot for Łodž/Warsaw. Easy to get there by bus, cars slow down before the roundabout and have enough space to stop. Two cars stopped under 20 minutes and the second took us all the way to Warsaw.

Miejscowi kierowcy zatrzymywali, że by powiedzieć że na Poznań lepiej stanąć przed rondem koło przystanku autobusowego wcześniej.

Ostatecznie zrezygnowaliśmy z tego miejsca

We (2 people) got a ride here after only 20 minutes on a weekday, and they drove us straight to Warsaw (about 4h). Lovely and very freindly businessman on a work trip, we held a conversation with him the whole trip.

If you wanna go toward the Warsow this place seems to be very good. You can get there by #908 bus or #1 or #7 (in this cases you have to walk about 20 minutes north). Cars slow down before the roundabout and they can stop on buses' lay-by.

Yes how ukrainian i know, so i can say you that on this punkt of crossing, you cant do it on your foot, because its place only for cars and buses, autobuses, only place on Pl-UA border, where you can get to Ukrainian, (or polish) side by foot, it is near to the polish city Prsemsyl, Medyka-Shegyinni, its only place where you can do it by foot, on others, the policmens just will dont let you go , and will stop you, of course you can try to ask this cars who are waiting in the line, to cross a bor
You can not get to this place because it is located between the Polish and Ukrainian border, and it is not walking border
For border crossing
If you are hitchhiking in the Gdansk direction. There is enough space for one car to stop and simultaneously one car passing. Pretty good one!
It's pretty good because the cars need to slow down because of the roundabout
fast traffic so it's hard to stop something
Quite ok spot just before the S8. Traffic is a bit fast, but there's a nice hard shoulder to stop.
Pretty empty but still doable. I guess it would be easier for a single person due to many trucks but we got ride in the end too.
very little traffic coming through but slow traffic and very possible to hike west

Not too many people but spot seems ok, got a ride to Berlin with a sweet Kazach guy, had a lot of fun trying to get to know what Kazachstan is like trying to communicate in a mix of poor polish english and russian
The traffic isn't too great and there are no ideal spots for cars to stop but if you get there early enough in the morning then there is enough traffic to get a ride easily.
we asked around for a long while, people travelling long distances north and east but not worth the 1,5h commute from poznan

Most of the cars going to Bydgoszcz but you can find someone going east eventually. Nice spot to hang around in front of the gas station and talk to drivers, people are friendly. Got a ride to Warsaw with a person from Berlin going to Lithuania with their van.
Please note that this location no longer exists, as the oil station was demolished during the renovation of Route 7.

Great stop on the way North. There is a big petrol station here(Statoil). Nearly no local traffic. Very easy to get long distance ride towards Olsztyn, Gdansk, Torun or Bydgoszcz.

It's the first petrol station after crossin Vistula river, so easy to get here. And easy to leave:-)
in the middle of nowhere, almost nobody drives here, we waited for 2+ hours and had to catch a ride back to poznan (summer 2024)
Not a lot of traffic and workers will probably sent you away if you try to hitch behind the toll station. After the roundabout is okay though. Might be good to have a sign to indicate your direction.

Towards south, pretty okay location, but your better bet is for the cars coming from the junction, note: when walking here, go by the road 763, the area has high fence and nasty vegetation if you go next to the highway. waited 40 minutes
Good spot to hitchhike to the Katowice. We stayed only 15minutes.

Good place for going to Warsaw or to get to highway (direction North-Gdańsk; South-Stryków). 
Very comfortable place to stop for cars (bus stop with bus bay).
It's the bus stop "Słupska" - you could get there from the city center by bus 35. This bus stop is on request (flag stop).
Seems like it's only good for Sobotka. Waited 35 minutes with a sign right after the traffic lights
Great spot. Bus stop after the traffic lights. Nom nom.
Good spot if you just want to go to Sobótka (Ślęża).
Good spot to get to A4

The guy who picked us with his old alfa romeo told us, that it's one of the worst stops we could choose to hitchhike cause it's almost in the city centre....but he took us to Moll petrol station near Żary. I rate this pickup spot 3 stars out of 5.
It's a bus stop, so there were a lot of city buses, but our car stopped after few minutes.
We dont get a ride here. Go with any bus from here another two stationes and u will find better spot if you wanna go to gdaňsk.
very good place with big traffic
bus stop (line 52 with the letter 'P' or 'M', you can take a tram (the stop in Las Gdansk, tram number 1 or 2), a good place to hitchhike to Gdansk or at least to Osielsko
Not a good spot. After two hours we can go to toruń but no bydgoszcz rides.
Good place for the direction towards Bydgoszcz, Torun or Gdansk. Waited 20 min with Gdansk sign at the common exit of petrol station and McDonalds.
Tried this spot twice to berlin, most cars are local,takes long to get a ride
MOP Sędzinko, petrol station along the A2 towards Berlin.

It's a dangerous place (cars are really fast and buses are coming to the bus stop), so you have to be careful. Visibility is not good - you have to stand very close to the road, on the edge of bus stop. One person stood before the bridge (pedestrian passage) and the other on the bus stop, after one hour somebody took us only to Pszczyna. Pros: there is a place for a car to stop.
Good bus stop, to south of PL (like Bielsko-Biala) or to the border (Cieszyn).
Just stood here for 30 secs and instantly caught a ride. A lot of space to stop here.

I got there with the bus 35 and stopped at Odlegla II. The stop before (Slupska) may be better because at this point cars are driving already a bit fast but they have room to stop. I got picked towards the north after a long wait by a truck driver.

Direction: Kraków/Cracow
This might have been a good place a few years ago because there is a lot of space. Nowadays, when everybody ride expressway this place isn't good. If somebody ride this way it's probably going to Radom from Warsaw and stay here. I recomend ride a bus number 5 to "Młodocin Mniejszy I" and there is a nice place to catch a car to Kraków/Cracow
Dobre miejsce na Kraków (Kielce, Radom, Skarżysko)
It's a good place to reach Krakow. Many cars from Warsaw use this way I think. Cars are not so fast and there is a place to stop. 5-10 minutes waiting.
We got off here by accident. Our destination was Budapest. There was very little traffic, so after 40 minutes we decided to take the bus to Rabka Zabojnia.

2 boys, Sunday morning

Waited around 20 minutes with sign "SK" to Slovakia. Got ride to spot 4 km away in south direction.
2 boys to Jabłonka. ~10min. Our goal was Hungary.
2 boys to zakopane around 20 min
my girlfriend and i wait about 10 min.  to slovakia kosice. nice point

There is a bus stop at the exit from ELK, across the street it's a fuel station. This bus stop is a good place to stop cars, there is enough space for cars to stop. I was waiting 5 minutes with the sign: "GYZYCKO" and after one driver stopped and we went well. He was kind and he brought me to the address of my host from workaway.info
A good spot to go to Orzysz/Olsztyn. We stood there for about 20 minutes and got a ride to Olsztyn
Not the best one, but we were waiting around 1hour and find a ride directly do Gdańsk
a driver picked me up before I even started hitchiking. Good place to go to Orzysz
Terrible spot, not many traffic in this petrol station and very long time to have a ride.. mostly people from Elk just take fuel and that's it
Not possible anymore and quite dangerous
Never waited more than 20 minutes
I've used this spot (even before the modernization) for the last 10 years whenever I've been going west. Thumbs up !
Never stayed more than 15 min for Warsaw's ride's.
once I've got ride in 10 minutes, the second time I didn't get it at all.
I was standing closer to Moya gas station. good place for Gdansk.
It's a good spot to hitchhike in direction to Gdansk. There are two patrol stations next to each other, but the best is catching where bus stop (there's a place to stop, not like in gas stations).
plenty of cars and space, but still waited a long time. maybe we had a misleading sign. intheend got a ride to jawor.
There is a bus stop with plenty space to stop.

During the night not so many cars/trucks, but still enough to catch a Ukrainian truck and sleep in his bed while he drove me to Krakow, where I wanted to stop. Others I asked were heading just to Wroclaw direction.

good to Wroclaw
not so good for Dresden. 
first car direction Dresden took us, but long time we just found cars to Wroclaw
I started at 4pm Monday evening with a sign for Lublin. Nobody stopped in more than 2 hours, so I decided to take a train to my destination.
Another good place towards Lublin. There is a bus stop there so very easy to stop the car for a moment.
Its ok but could be better

Good place to ask for a ride, it connects to lot of highways, specially if you are hitchhiking for a place inside Poland. 
 It has place for the cars to stop. 
You can take the city bus 106 and stop at "Park Tysiaclecia"
Last gas station before Gliwice, great amenities (showers, laundromat) Not many people stopping but for us easy to get a lift to Lodz.
Best spot when u are hitchiking alone as there are so many truck drivers, but cars ride more to Katowice or Wroclaw. I recommend you to stay nearby gas station no at the end of parking.
low traffic, but asking every driver coming in
Truck drivers weren't stopping.
Not good not terible, but we were dropped on the roundabout, so we didn't have another option. We had a ride to czestochowe. It's not the best for cars, but if they want to pick you up, they will.
mega nie polecam nikt sie nie zatrzymuje, ponad godzina czekania i dupa
Duży ruch i dobre miejsce do zatrzymania się.
Waited on the bus stop. Nobody even stopped
Used to be a great spot - not anymore. There is a new way to Wroclaw. This s not a good spot to Radom also, cars are driving too fast - get the bus to Łazy, there is a gas station
Road under construction, as stated above. Waited 2h for someone to give us a lift to Krakow, no luck :(
Waited 2 and a half hours by the bus stop, no one stopped, gave up.
Seems like a very good spot in the bus station, but waited for 2h and a half for a ride to Krakow, and finally quit.
We waited there for 1.30h so it was a not a lucky point for us. But it might be a good point in other days, not for a long-weekend-hitchhike. Quite good visibility.
Lots of traffic though I think it's mostly local and there are 3 lanes which means it's harder them to stop but it's a good place if You're going to the Katowice or Kraków direction :)

This is a very popular spot to hike out of Warsaw - lots of local traffic, but it's also not very hard to get a ride to Krakow or Katowice. Hike straightly from the bus stop - lots of people are travelling from that point so you have to be prepared that sometimes there is a crowd of hitchhikers here. This is also the place where a bus to Janki stops - there is actually a better spot for hiking. Keep in mind that drivers taking you to Radom usually expect some money from you, so make this clear b
Showed sign for 5 seconds, two guys and two girls, can stopped instantly. Nice spot right behind traffic lights with bus stop, so cars can stop.
Only rides to Stęszew which is terrible spot to catch something. Jebać Stęszew. Not recommended.
Bus stop, use it to arrive to Stęszew, Grodzisk Wlkp and Zielona Góra

cars go in high speed, fellow hitchhikers we met when we got to this spot said that it took them 2 hours and nothing, they went trying luck more near to the airport. i suggest you to try just before the troll station, cars go slowly there because of the queue
Might be good to get cars East/to Krakow. Toll station.

I had a hard time there
Most of the people stay in nowy targ
There's a bus stop. 2 girls got a ride to Krakow in less than five minutes.
Got a ride to Cieszyn pretty fast, nobody bothered me although all the gates and police are scary, was standing begind the gates, there is good parking spot there
Just before highway toll zone, direction: A4 highway (Wroclaw or Katowice)
hitch right after the roundabout. more likely than not, you'll only get short rides.
We (2 boys 17 yo) asked people in cars, around the gas station for 15 minutes untill someone told us that he can take us to Katowice - around 1h drive

There's a parking nearby the train station and a gas station about 50m to the north. There's also a bus station nearby gas station so you can wave your finger around as cars do not go very fast here, but I think that the best option is asking people on the gas station.
It took us (2 boys) around 10mins to catch a ride towards Czechowice-Dziedzice (10km northwards).
Towards Tychy, Katowice.
I waited for an hour and half. The majority of cars are local traffic. I then moved to the bus stop directly on the ramp. Got a lift to Wyszków in 20 minutes.
First car i asked took me! Nice spot ;) I asked for Wyrzkow!

Better than the further spot, because the ticket bus is cheaper, and there is gazstations. Not easy, lot of locals people, as always, but still very possible statistically, because thousands of car per hour =D
Quite a lot of traffic, a gas station, some possibilities for cars to stop, could be a bit better though and easy to access by bus going to petia CH Marki / M1 Marki
Waited for over an hour, did not get a ride. Decided to move forward by bus.

I wouldn't recommend it. We used it to get to Warsaw and were really lucky but I don't think that you have a good chance getting a ride. Most drivers are only driving a really short distance. Our driver was on his way home after work (distance about 1km) but he was so kind to take us all the way to a big gas station at the highway in Gozdowo! He only went there for us so we can get to Warsaw.
1h of wait but worth it as the guy literaly drop me central warsaw , he wass going to a meeting , nice mercedes car !
I waited there 11 minutes and got a direct lift to Warsaw. As this is a bus stop, there is also a shelter in case of rain.

Bus stop "Skansen" in Swarzędz just at the side of the busy 92 road leading to Września and further to Warsaw. Many people heading for Warsaw use this road as it leads straight from the centre and is toll-free. There is a frequent 401 bus going there from Śródka Dworzec in Poznań, costing just 2.60 PLN (9.2014). The spot is just after street lights, so cars regularly stop there and the speed limit is 50 km/h so they have enough time to react and stop.
Mostly local traffic. The station is next to lidl and most people go there. Waited for an hour, asked drivers at the gas station, then gave up and took a bus further.

really un friendly bad drivers. mostly ignore you. some of them are friendly but not kind.
waited 3 hrs. and finally ONE car stopped. it was our direction. but while asking few second other old man cars come n complain about his stupid life n suddenly our main car has left. 
this is so rediculas experience in my 20yrs travelling. 
many ppl r grumpy n keep ignore you.

pretty sad area.

3 drivers give us middle fingures while passing. terrible country

If you fail to thumb a ride from a road, you can ask drivers on gas station. 
If you are heading to Gniezno, Toruń, Bydgoszcz direction, it's better to hike on Gnieźnieńska street, 2 km north from here.
Good place, but cars are going very fast here, so sometimes you have to wait quite long. Advantage- it's easy to reach this place.
I was travelling very often from there. The spot is really good, enough space to stop for a car. Someitmes it took me 30 min to get a lift sometimes longer.
